intro: Calathiana sierrae, commonly known as Sierra larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as meadows and forest understories. Its leaves are palmately divided and have a distinctive, somewhat fuzzy texture. Calathiana sierrae is an important species for local pollinators and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
